item.title: Report E-2023080644
item.description:
Report E-2023080644

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced aUN1090 Klean Strip Acetone release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon metal jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of Acetone released impacting the cardboard packaging only due to being crushed by other freight. Four damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. Four impacted and damaged but not leaking containers of Jasco Premium Paint & Epoxy Remover were also containerized into a 30-gallon metal drum. All impacted cardboard was collected and containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report X-2023080667
item.description:
Report X-2023080667

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET ON ONE CORNER AND GIVING OFF A PETROLEUM ODOR. LOOSELY PACKED BOX DESPITE SLOTTED PARTITIONS. SPIDR INDICATES PACKAGE ALREADY DAMAGED BEFORE BEING SORTED. DescribePack: ONE PAINT CAN WITH LID RETAINING RING OFF WITH LID PARTIALLY OPEN. ONE CAN OF EPOXY HARDENER SOILED FROM SPILT EPOXY BASE. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

DescribePack: 1 of 4 bottles had loose cap inside of box causing leakage inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottles were placed in plastic bags and proper hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2023081509
item.description:
Report X-2023081509

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-20
  • City: FRENCH CAMP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Container HGIU 516245 (load-mixed hazmat) released 0.5 gallons of liquid from the bottom of the container to the ground in the Lathrop yard. 3 out of 12 5-gallon pails of "Zep Morado Super Clean", UN3266 Corrosive Liquid, Basic, Inorganic, N.O.S. (Sodium Thiophosphate) were damaged and released. 1 pail completely released, and the other 2 pails each released 1-gallon, with a total of 7-gallons released. Cause of the release was shifted load and no blocking and bracing.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: HESPERIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West unit was traveling on Muscatel Street in Hesperia, California. The driver hit an area of the roadway that was washed out due to rain. The trailer rolled over and approximately 2000 gallons of gasoline was released. Patriot Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2023080695
item.description:
Report E-2023080695

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of clog attack (un1760) damaging 2 of the inner poly one gallon jugs and releasing 2 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080609
item.description:
Report E-2023080609

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted (from being double stacked ) in transit and that one case of acetone (un1090) had been damaged by other freight and that one of the inner metal 1 gallon can had released 1 gallon of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023080604
item.description:

item.title: Report E-2023080531
item.description:
Report E-2023080531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 31, 2023, five (5) 5-gallon pails of UN2491 were crushed in transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Customers Power Bank started smoking on board Flight 4521 prior to the flight departing the gate. The Customer gave the power bank to the Provo Agent. The Provo Agent took the Power Bank to the top of the Jetway and gave it to the Operation Agent. The power bank was no longer smoking, so Airport Operations advised SWA to dispose of item. OAK Maintenance came to get item to place in a fire containment bag, per SWA Safety and Security.

item.title: Report I-2023070016
item.description:
Report I-2023070016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-12
  • City: ESCONDIDO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Waste material was staged onto a pallet with other materials then loaded onto an lngenium truck at the customer's facility. The shipment was then routed through the lngenium - Santa Clara transfer facility, then to the lngenium - Escondido transfer facility. Upon arrival, lngenium - Escondido operations began unloading the shipment from the trailer with a forklift. The pallet with the container in question come into contact with a protruding piece of aluminum siding. The container sustained a 5 to 6 inch gash near the bottom and immediately drained onto the trailer floor. The material began leaking onto the loading dock pavement when a second employee noticed and notified the forklift driver. The forklift driver placed the pallet down and backed the forklift out of the trailer. The driver donned his respirator, grabbed absorbent, and began covering the release. The second employee notified the manager. The material was contained before spreading from beneath the trailer. The used absorbent was removed and drummed for disposal.

The damaged drums were overpacked containing the release.
